NewsLines.HeadLine: Chinese Monopoly On Rare Earth Metals Challenged

ContentItem.DataContent: China's worldwide monopoly over the production and exportation of rare earth metals, and its strict export quotas over their distribution, is being challenged by the United States and Japan. Both countries are looking for alternative ways to obtain these scarce resources that are indispensable in many modern and hi-tech electronics products.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Chinese Monopoly On Rare Earth Metals Challenged

ContentItem.DataContent: Rare earth materials include compounds to make the strongest magnets known and are found in every car and a huge number of electronic devices, particularly those associated with information storage.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Chinese Monopoly On Rare Earth Metals Challenged

ContentItem.DataContent: A Tennessee man has been indicted for threatening Rep. John Boccieri (D-OH) for his support of healthcare reform early this year. The charge is the latest in the investigation of threats received by several Democratic lawmakers during debate on the healthcare reform bill.
